intro: Aneilema beniniense subsp. leonense, commonly known as the Leonese aneilema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences composed of numerous small, white to pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for both horticultural and ecological studies.
